title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
In the UK in the period January to September (Q1-3) 2025:

Box office revenue was £751 million, up 10% on Q1-3 2024 and down 18% on Q1-3 2019.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
There were 93 million cinema admissions, 4% higher than in Q1-3 2024 and 28% lower than in Q1-3 2019.
Figures are for all films on release, including event releases and those that started their release prior to the Q1-3 period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
July recorded 2025’s highest monthly admissions to date, at 13 million.
Jurassic World Rebirth and Superman were the highest earning releases of that month.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
At the UK and Republic of Ireland (ROI) box office:

Revenue for films released in Q1-3 2025 was £684.4 million, up 1% on Q1-3 2024 and down 25% on Q1-3 2019.
This excludes event releases.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
The total market share of all UK qualifying films was 43%, almost 12 percentage points higher than Q1-3 2024’s UK qualifying share.
Note: 2025 figures in chart sum to 44% due to rounding.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to September 2025:

The combined total spend on film and high-end television (HETV) production was £6.5 billion.
This graph shows the figures that were ‘first reported’ for production spend in each 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
Production data is revised every period to account for lags in obtaining complete data across all types of productions.
Combined spend for the 12 months to September 2025 was up 14% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: HETV accounted for 64% of UK production spend in the 12 months to September 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: UK spend on film production was £2.3 billion, up 6% compared with revised figures for the 12 months ending September 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
The BFI assigns productions to one of three categories:

Inward investment features (INW)
Domestic UK features (DOM)
Co-productions (COP)

See notes to statistics releases for full definitions.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: UK spend on HETV projects was £4.2 billion in the 12 months to September 2025, up 19% on revised figures for the previous 12-month period.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
Spend on all categories of production increased compared with revised figures for the 12 months to September 2024.
Note: INW and COP spend is combined for the 12 months to September 2021 for reasons of disclosure control.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
In the UK, in the 12 months to September 2025:

Combined production starts were down 8% on first reported figures for the 12 months to September 2024.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: Production count for the 12 months to September 2025 is lower than for the other periods shown here. However, as previously noted, figures are likely to be revised upward in subsequent statistical releases as more data becomes available.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: We saw earlier that HETV accounted for the majority of UK production spend in the 12 months to September 2025. In terms of number of productions, however, the split is almost even: 49% for film, 51% for HETV.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: 167 films were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to September 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: Lags in obtaining complete data on production activity tend to disproportionately affect counts for domestic UK feature films (DOM), particularly those with budgets of less than £500,000.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: 171 HETV programmes were recorded as starting principal photography in the UK in the 12 months to September 2025.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
HETV programme starts in the 12 months to September 2025 included 19 feature-length single episode productions.
Note: INW and COP counts are combined for the 12 months to September 2021 for reasons of disclosure control.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
In the 12 months to September 2025:

A total of 585 films received final certification, either under the cultural test or as an official co-production.
Certification is required to access UK tax reliefs and credits for audiovisual and video game expenditure.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
Films achieving final certification in the 12 months to September 2025 had an associated UK production spend of £1.9 billion.
Films and other productions can apply for final certification when they have completed production and are ready to be released.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
281 HETV titles received final certification through the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: HETV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025 had a UK production spend of £4.7 billion.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
72 animation television programmes received final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: Animation TV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025 had a UK production spend of £196 million.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
101 children’s television programmes received final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025.
There were two co-productions with final certification but details are not included for disclosure control reasons.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text: Children’s TV productions receiving final certification under the cultural test in the 12 months to September 2025 had a UK production spend of £134 million.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
256 video games received final certification in the 12 months to September 2025.
Video games can only be certified under the cultural test.

title: BFI screen sector statistics to September 2025
text:
Video games receiving final certification in the 12 months to September 2025 had a UK production spend of £736 million.
This is the second highest UK spend figure on record.
